org.smtlib.sexpr

Class Factory

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.smtlib.sexpr.Factory
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IParser.IFactory

    public class Factory
extends java.lang.Object
implements IParser.IFactory
    This is the factory for classes that are part of this particular concrete representation of SMT-LIB syntax: Parser, Printer, Source for parsers.
    Author:
    David R. Cok

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Factory() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Parser createParser(SMT.Configuration smtConfig, ISource source)
      Creates a parser that reads and parses concrete syntax from the given source
      IPrinter createPrinter(SMT.Configuration smtConfig, java.io.Writer w)
      Creates a printer
      Pos.Source createSource(java.lang.CharSequence cs, java.lang.String location)
      Creates a character source from the given CharSequence; the second argument is just to be used as a location designator.
      Pos.Source createSource(SMT.Configuration smtConfig, java.io.File file)
      Creates a character source from the given file
      Pos.Source createSource(SMT.Configuration smtConfig, java.io.InputStream file, java.lang.Object location)
      Creates a character source from the given stream
      static void initFactories(SMT.Configuration config)
      This method will initialize the factories and default printer in the configuration with appropriate objects from this implementation; it should be called as part of initial set up of the configuration.
